subsection.name: Windows
subsection.p:
Requirements:
Java JRE 1.5 or higher (see section below for Java JRE 1.4 support)
Winzip
Download the latest binary distribution - i.e., pmd-bin-x.xx.zip
Unzip it into any directory, i.e., c:\pmd\

subsection.name: Unix
subsection.p:
Requirements:
Java JRE 1.5 or higher (see section below for Java JRE 1.4 support)
The Unix "zip" utility InfoZip
Download the latest binary distribution - i.e., pmd-bin-x.xx.zip

Unzip it into any directory:
[tom@hal tmp]$ unzip -q pmd-bin-5.0.zip [tom@hal tmp]$ ls -l total 4640 drwxrwxr-x 5 tom tom 4096 Apr 17 16:38 pmd-5.0 -rw-rw-r-- 1 tom tom 4733312 Jun 9 15:44 pmd-bin-5.0.zip [tom@hal tmp]$
Note that the PMD jar file contains the CPD utility as well.

subsection.name: Java JRE 1.4 support
subsection.p: By default PMD requires a 1.5 JRE but thanks to retroweaver, you can still use PMD with a 1.4 JRE.

You do not need to download any extra library or application as the PMD releases are self contained. Instead of using the executables located in the "bin" directory, you should just use the equivalent ones from the "java14/bin" directory instead.
